header.p: Smilies is a half-game, half-story concept I developed while doodling in my notebooks. I'm not sure when I drew my first Smiley, nor am I sure that I knew it was a Smiley at the time. The Smiley concept has grown over time in the back of my mind, but has not been officially drafted until now.

section.p: Smilies are a race of two-dimensional lifeforms. They take the shape of smiley faces, with some variants that will be discussed later. They reproduce, age, and interact with their environment like most lifeforms. They reproduce asexually, and have no gender. They do not die from old age.
While Smileys may look friendly and happy, they are constantly at war. The sworn enemy of the Smiley is the Figure. Figures and Smileys have been at war for almost their entire history.
Smileys fight off Figures with their eyes, which emit Figure-melting lasers. A Figure need only to touch a Smiley to kill it.
The lifespan of a Smiley runs through the following consecutive stages: infancy, adolescence, adulthood.

text.p: Smileys are born out of a special kind of Smiley called "Breeders". New Smileys, called "Blinkers", emerge from Breeders as very small beings. They have one-dimensional dot-like eyes and a small, upturned smile. Blinkers' eyes are not fully developed at birth, and cannot perform their intended function.
After a short period of time, a Blinker's eyes will fully develop.
Young Smileys that can use their eyes are called Boomers. Boomers mature by exercising their eyes. The more they use their eyes, the faster they mature.

When a Boomer has exercised its eyes enough, its eyes gain a dimension and become lines. Its mouth also grows. The result is a mature Smiley that is visually distinct from what it was before. Mature Smileys are called "Adults", "Beamers", or sometimes just "Smileys".
Adult Smileys are not so different from Boomers. They are larger, with more effective eyes, but otherwise they serve the same role in society.

section.p: There are several variations in the Smiley society.

text.p: Eyebrows are an added ability developed by some Boomers and Beamers. Eyebrows are a mark of increased intelligence, strength, speed, and vitality.

The ratio of Browed Smileys to normal Smileys in a given society is determined by the overall health of the society. When a society is fewer in number, more Smileys will become browed in order to increase the chances of the society's survival. In other words, the ratio changes as necessary in order to promote the overall health of the society.
Smileys with eyebrows are referred to as "Browed", as in "Browed Beamer".
Browed Beamers can also become Breeders. This would only happen in very dire situations, where the life of a whole society is threatened.
Some Boomers use their eyes almost constantly from the time they are able. Rapid maturation leads to a different kind of adult eye than normal. Instead of gaining one dimension, they gain two.
Smileys with two-dimensional eyes, called "Lookers", have 5x the offensive strength of normal adults at the time of maturation.

Some Beamers are born leaders. As they age they cultivate understanding of strategic warfare, effective planning, and resourceful management. Other Smileys are drawn to their leadership, and they develop Dimples. Smileys that weren't otherwise attracted to leadership qualities instinctively acknowledge the authority of Dimpled Smileys, also called "Leaders".
Browed Leaders are an extraordinary asset to a Smiley society, as their heightened abilities include their leadership qualities. This also makes them a priority target of Figures.
Lookers cannot become Leaders, nor can Breeders.
Some Smileys just aren't cut out to kill Figures.

In a given society of Smileys, adult individuals can naturally be selected to become Breeders whenever the Breeder population is low. As necessary, a given adult Smiley will undergo a native transformation through which its mouth will open wide, its size will greatly increase, and its eyes will cease to function (the sole exception being Browed Breeders).
Breeders will immediately start ejecting new Blinkers once their transformation is complete.
Leaders cannot become Breeders. A Leader's role is far too important to be sacrificed. Also, Lookers cannot become Breeders for a smiliar reason.
